articles.name: Moderating Apps on Discord
articles.title: Moderating Apps on Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • What are apps?
  • How do apps become available in my server?
    • Apps in Your Server
    • External Apps
  • How do I moderate apps?
    • Use External Apps
    • Use Application Commands
    • Use Activities
    • Command Permissions
    • Bot Permissions
    • Automod
  • Permissions Chart

What are Apps?

Discord Apps add functionality, entertainment, and productivity tools to your servers, direct messages (DMs), and group chats. These apps can range from bots that automate tasks, to commands that give you quick access to useful and fun actions, to Activities that allow you to play games, collaborate on projects, or share experiences with others directly within Discord.

You can find more information on how to use apps on Discord here.

How do apps become available in my server?

Apps in Your Server

The Manage Server permission allows members to add apps to the server, making them available for everyone to use. Apps can be discovered in a number of places, including our App Directory.

You can find more information about adding and using apps here.

You can see a list of apps that have been added to your server by going to Server Settings > Integrations. You can also use the Integrations page to remove an app from your server.

When added to your server, apps are able to access certain data without specific permissions. You can see what data they have access to by navigating to their profile and going to Data Access. You can read more about data access in our article Visibility of Bot Data Access.

External Apps

Some apps are also available to users everywhere on Discord. By adding an app to your account, you can use it in all your servers, DMs, and group chats. These apps can be used in your server, but will not show up in Server Settings > Integrations, as they have not been added to your server.

Because these apps are not installed directly to your server, they don’t have permissions to do anything other than send messages, including attachments and embeds.

How do I moderate apps?

If you’re a server owner or moderator, you may want to moderate how your members use apps in your server. You have several controls at your disposal to set up your server in a way that works best for you and your community:

  • “Use External Apps” permission: control whether your server members can use their own apps.

    Note: The “Use External Apps” permission will be rolling out on June 18th, 2024. 

  • “Use Application Commands” permission: control who can use commands from apps.
  • “Use Activities” permission: control who can use Activities.
  • Command Permissions: control access to specific app commands from server-installed apps.
  • Bot Permissions: control server permissions for apps with bot users.
  • AutoMod: block keywords within messages sent by external apps.

To better understand how these permissions interact with each other, we’ve included a helpful chart located near the end of this article.

Use External Apps

Some apps are available to users everywhere on Discord. By adding an app to your account, you can use it in all your servers, DMs, and group chats. You can think of these apps as “external” to your server, compared to ones that have been added by you or your server moderators.

If you do not want members of your server to be able to use external apps, you can manage permissions by updating the “Use External Apps” permission. This permission can be changed for the whole server, specific channels, individual roles, and members.

Disabling the “Use External Apps” permission will prevent external apps from posting publicly  on your server. However, these apps can still be used; they will reply privately to the individual through an ephemeral message. This allows other Discord users to keep access to non-intrusive functionality that apps may offer, such as message translations, without being visible to other users.

Navigate to your Server Settings > Roles > Apps Permissions to locate the Use External Apps permission.

Use Application Commands

Commands are quick actions used to interact with apps, and can be accessed in a few ways:

  • Launching apps with the Shapes button
  • Typing / to see a list of slash commands
  • Right-clicking on users and messages

You can use the “Use Application Commands” permission to deny or grant members of your server the ability to use any commands from apps, whether they’re external or added to your server. This permission is available under Server Settings > Roles > Apps Permissions.

Disabling this permission will make commands from server apps completely inaccessible to your server members.

 Server members can still use commands from external apps, but these messages will only reply privately to the individual through an ephemeral message.

Use Activities

Activities allow you to enjoy shared experiences, such as games and media, with friends directly on Discord. 

Activities can be played inside both voice and text channels by selecting the Activities  [] icon or the Apps [] button. 

You can revoke the ability to use activities by disabling the “Use Activities” permission. Disabling this permission restricts activities from being used. Navigate to your Server Settings > Roles > Apps Permissions to locate the “Use Activities” permission.

 Learn more information regarding Activities in our Activities on Discord Help Center article.

Command Permissions

Permissions can be controlled for individual commands to give you granular control over apps added to your server. By default, commands from apps in your server are available to every member, in every channel. You may want to limit specific functionality  to your members, disallow other commands, or restrict them to members with specific roles.

 1. To locate the Command Permissions, head over to your Server Settings > Integrations. 

2. While there, select an app that’s been added to your server. 

3. Once selected, you can control:

  • Which roles and members can use the app
  • The channels in which the app can be used
  • Individual overrides for each command — where it can be used, and who can use it

      

Head over to our Command Permissions Help Center article for additional information and examples.

Bot Permissions

Certain apps, when added to your server, may request user permissions to perform specific actions such as:

  • Creating and editing channels
  • Sending messages, without command inputs 
  • Connecting to voice channels
  • Viewing the Audit Log

 When authorizing an app, you will be able to view the permissions needed..

If you ever want to change which permissions an app has within your server, you can go to Server Settings > Roles and search for the name of the app. You will see a role that you can then edit.

AutoMod

Discord’s AutoMod feature allows you to automatically scan, detect, and block unwanted and risky content before it’s ever posted. AutoMod will not scan or flag messages from apps that are installed to your server. It will only flag messages from external apps.

 Any actions taken by AutoMod will happen on the user who installed the application and first used it in a server. This means if an application creates a message with buttons, additional messages created from interacting with those buttons will also action against the user who first used the command.

 Learn more about AutoMod in our AutoMod FAQ.

Permissions Chart

As a server moderator, you have numerous controls available for moderating apps, securing your server’s safety, and customizing it to your liking. To simplify which permissions you can modify to achieve your desired setup, we’ve included this chart: 

I want members of my server to Use External Apps Use Application Commands Use Activities
Use all apps, their commands, and their Activities ✅ ✅ ✅
Use commands from external apps and apps in my server, but not their Activities ✅ ✅ ❌
Use commands and Activities from apps installed to the server, but not from external apps ❌ ✅ ✅
Use commands from server apps, but not external apps, and not use Activities ❌ ✅ ❌
Use Activities from server apps, but not external apps, and not use commands from any apps ❌ ❌ ✅
Not use apps ❌ ❌ ❌
Not use apps (by blocking commands and Activities) ✅ ❌ ❌

articles.name: Epic Games x Discord 2024 Promo
articles.title: Epic Games x Discord 2024 Promo
articles.body:
Starting from May 16, 2024 (11:00am EDT) to June 13, 2024 (11:00am EDT), Epic Game Store users can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro from the Epic Games Store. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 1 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim through an email from the Epic Games Store by June 13, 2024 (11:00am EDT) and redeem in your Discord account by July 13, 2024 (11:59pm EDT).

Membership: After the 1 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method for per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings.

What this article covers:

  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Epic Games Store account?  
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Subscription Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our subscription plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Epic Games Store account?  

In order to claim this Nitro trial promotion, you must have an Epic Games Store account.

1. Head over to the Epic Game Store app from May 16, 2024 (11:00am EDT) to June 13, 2024 (11:00am EDT) and you should see the Nitro trial promotion on the homepage. 

2. Press on the promotion to get started on redeeming Nitro.

3. Then, check your email tied to your Epic Games Store account to find an email from the Epic Games Store about this promotion. Try searching for "Nitro" in your email inbox!

Please make sure the email address associated with your Epic Games Store account is current and correct! Allow for up to 24 hours for email delivery and check your spam folder.

4. Once you have found the email, follow the prompts to claim the Nitro trial and you'll be automatically redirected to a browser window to redeem the promotion.

The unique promotion link will look like this: https://discord.com/billing/promotions/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo link, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo link on your Discord account (or share this code with a friend). You must redeem this Nitro trial by July 13, 2024 (11:59pm EDT).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

NOTE:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Pressing the Promo Link/Copy and Pasting into your Browser Window

Start by directly pressing the promotion link or right clicking the link to copy and paste the link into your browser window.

Note:If you're redeeming this Nitro promo link in the Discord Gift Inventory, enter only your unique 24-digit code from the Nitro promotion link in the following format: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX

Step 2 - Logging into Discord

If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Step 3 - Confirming the Correct Account and Payment Method

Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.

  • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________" 

If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)

When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button.

Note: If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 4 - Membership Now Activated

After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro membership on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you find the email from the Epic Games Store with the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion link and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by July 13, 2024 (11:59pm EDT).

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Epic Games Store users can claim Discord Nitro promo between May 16, 2024 (11:00am EDT) to June 13, 2024 (11:00am EDT).

After July 13, 2024 (11:59pm EDT), Epic Game Store users will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by July 13, 2024 (11:59pm EDT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by  July 13, 2024 (11:59pm EDT) it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 1 month of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion?

A: You must have an Epic Games Store account to claim this promotion through an email sent from the Epic Games Store to your email associated with your Epic Games Store account.

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 1 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 1 month.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: What if I didn't receive an email from Epic Games Store with the Nitro promo link, even if I have an Epic Games Store account?

A: In order to receive an email from Epic Games Store with the Nitro promo link, you must have an Epic Games Store account.

Additionally, make sure that you've opted to receive marketing emails from the Epic Games Store. If you've unsubscribed, you sadly won't be able to see this offer. 

If you believe you are eligible for the promotion, contact Epic Games Store's support team: https://www.epicgames.com/help/en-US/

Q: I see a Sad Trombone error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo link.

A: Would you happen to be entering this Nitro promo link from the promotion into the Discord Gift Inventory or as a link within Discord chat?

If so, this is the incorrect method for redeeming the Nitro promo link, and you will see an error when attempting to redeem the promotion.

In order to successfully claim this promotion, enter only your unique 24-digit code from the Nitro promotion link in the following format: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX.

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on. Or you can give the promotion link to a friend who hasn't had Nitro before.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 1 month perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord username and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been redeemed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo link has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've redeemed this promo link on another Discord account.

In particular, if you redeem this promo link using your mobile device, double check the browser on your mobile device and see which Discord account you are currently logged into.

Unfortunately, once the promo link has been redeemed, the promo link cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the link is invalid. If you've copy and pasted this link, we recommend you double check the link you were given once more and make sure it exactly matches the link sent to your email.

If you received this link from a friend, double check with your friend on the exact link to make sure that it matches the link in their email.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if your friend has given an invalid link and we will not be able to provide a new link.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: I’m having trouble with my Epic Games Store account.

A: Reach out to Epic Games Store’s support team: https://www.epicgames.com/help/en-US/

articles.name: Guilds FAQ
articles.title: Guilds FAQ
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • What are Guilds?
  • How to Create a Guild
  • How to make Changes to your Guild
  • How to Approve or Reject Applications
  • How to Join a Guild
    • Discovery
    • Invite Link
    • Guild Tag
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are Guilds?

Guilds can only have a maximum of 200 members. This Guild member capacity cannot be increased at this time.

On Discord, a Guild is a small, exclusive server where people who regularly play games together collaborate, compete, and hang out. Guilds recruit members by application and provide their members with a sense of tight-knit community, support, and shared identity.

How to Create a Guild

This feature is currently an experiment and only available to a select number of servers.

You can either create a Guild from scratch by creating a brand new server or converting your current server into a Guild. If your server is currently in the experiment, you will see an option to convert your server as an in-app popup at the top-left of your app. Tap on Check it out to continue. 

1. Choose the game(s) you and your Guild play together. You can also change this later if you want to add more games or edit the current ones.

2. Select the playstyle of your Guild. You can choose between the following:

  • Very Casual
  • Casual
  • Hardcore
  • Very Hardcore

3. (Optional) Choose the type of demographic you want to recruit to your Guild. Depending on the type of Guild you have, you can select ranks for a specific game, minimum ages, and more. Pick what best suits your Guild.

4. Tell people what your Guild talks about. Does everyone have a HUGE love of cheesecake? Does everyone listen to k-pop while gaming? Select at least 3 Traits for your Guild.

5. You can write the discovery description for your Guild. Focus on why someone should join and what your Guild offers. You can also describe your Guild in 3 words here too. Be creative!

6. Create a Guild tag and badge that members will wear all over Discord to rep your Guild. Your Guild tag can be a max of 4 characters. However it is not unique and multiple Guilds can have the same tag. Once you select a badge, you can change the color to either one of the preset color schemes or use the color picker to customize. 

7. Customize your Guild brand even further by selecting a banner color scheme or using the eyedropper tool to pick 2 colors. You can also select the banner style and pick between the following:

  • Night Sky
  • Castle
  • World Map
  • Sea Foam
  • Warp
  • House
  • Pulsar
  • Mesh
  • Spatter

8. Set up an application for users interested in joining your Guild. You can include questions like, “why do you want to join this Guild?” Or “what’s your favorite dinosaur and why?” You can choose to make the responses be a short paragraph, a long paragraph, or multiple choice. You must have at least one question set up to proceed.

9. Now you’re done! Sign the charter and your Guild is now created. Don’t forget to don your Guild tag!

How to make Changes to your Guild

1. Navigate to the Guild you want to make changes to.

2. Tap on the server name in the top-left and then tap on Server Settings and then navigate to the Guild Settings tab.

3. Here you can go through any of your Guild settings and make adjustments as needed. Once finished, tap on Save & Exit in the top-right corner.

How to Approve or Reject Applications

Once someone has submitted an application to your Guild, you can approve or reject their application. We recommend approving or rejecting your applications as soon as you can!

 

1. Navigate to the Guild you want to review applications for and tap on Member Applications. If you have any to review, you’ll also see a number indicator listed.

2. On this page, you can see any Pending, Approved, and Rejected applications. You can also make changes to the application as well. 

3. If you want to learn more about the user that applied to your Guild you can tap on Start Interview to create a group chat with the user and any other admins in your Guild. This allows you to get to know one another more and see if the Guild is a right fit for them.

4. You can leave this tab anytime you are finished with reviewing applications.

How to Join a Guild

This feature is currently an experiment and only available to a select number of users.

There are 3 ways to join a Guild: Discovery tab, invite links, and guild tags.

Discovery

If you tap on the Discovery tab in your Discord app, you can see a list of available Guilds that you can apply to join. You can also set different preferences depending on what you are looking for in a Guild. Once you find one you’d like to join, tap on the Guild and then fill out an application. You can join as many Guilds as you’d like!

Invite Link

Just like a server, an invite link can be created for a Guild to invite other users to join! 

Guild Tag

If you see the option Join Waitlist for Guilds instead of Apply To Join, this means that you do not have access to the experiment. You can only join the waitlist once and joining does not guarantee access to the experiment.

If you see in a message or on someone’s profile a Guild you want to join, you can tap on the tag for the Guild and then tap on Apply To Join to pull up the application.

If your application has been approved, you’ll be added into that server for that Guild. If it’s been rejected, you’ll receive a notification stating so.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How can I stop being a Guild?

A: Tap on the drop-down for your Guild and then tap on Server Settings > Guild Settings. Under here you should see an option that says Disable Guild. 

Q: How do I leave a Guild?

A: To leave a Guild, you have to leave the Guild server. Right-click on the server icon and tap on Leave Server. If you leave the server for the Guild, you will have to reapply in order to join again.

Q: How many Guilds can I join?

A: There is no limit to how many Guilds you can join, however, you can only have 1 Guild tag displayed at a time next to your username. 

Q: My server isn’t a guild, but I see people with guild tags. Can I disable them from appearing on my server?

A: No. Only the individual member can disable/enable guild tags.

Q: Can I moderate guild tags in my server?

A: Yes, guild tags are subject to a server’s AutoMod rules. If a user displays a guild tag that violates an AutoMod rule, they will become quarantined and unable to display that guild tag.

Q: Can I have guests join my Guild to play games, without needing to join or apply?

A: Yes, you can send a Guest Voice Channel invite, and another person can use it to join your voice channel, without having to apply or become a member of the server. They will not be able to see any other channels in the Guild and will not be able to return to the server after disconnecting from the voice channel.

Q: Are tags limited to 4 characters? Are these characters restricted to being alphanumeric? 

A: Yes, tags are limited to 4 characters. It is not alphanumeric, numbers and special characters are allowed. No emojis can be used.

Q: Are tags unique?

A: No, Guild tags are not locked to a specific Guild and anyone can use a tag as long as it fits within the requirements.

articles.name: Recently Played Games on Profiles
articles.title: Recently Played Games on Profiles
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • What is Recently Played Games?
  • How to Manage your Recently Played Games Settings
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is Recently Played Games?

This feature is currently an experiment and limited to a small percentage of users. 

Recently Played Games will display a maximum of 3 tiles on a user’s profile showcasing the recent games that they played. The game, how long ago it was last played, and how much time has been spent playing the game will be displayed in these tiles.

How to Manage your Recently Played Games Settings

If a detectable game you recently played is not showing, here is how to enable it. 

Option 1

1. Tap on the cogwheel [] to enter your User Settings.

2. Select Connections. If the game you are playing is a verified game, the game should be available for you to add as a connection.

Option 2

1. Tap on the cogwheel [] to enter your User Settings.

2. Then head to Registered Games.

3. If you don’t  see your game here, tap on Add it to add the game (make sure your game is open when trying to add it).

4. If you want to prevent future sharing of a game, tap on the eye icon to disable detection.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How can I disable Recently Played Games from displaying on my profile?

A: Tap on the cogwheel [] to enter your User Settings, then head to Profiles. You should see the option to toggle this feature. A checkmark [] means it’s enabled and an [] means it’s disabled.

Q: How far back/how long can a game activity be displayed on my profile?

A: A game activity will be displayed on your profile for 1 month.

Q: Are Activities also captured in the recently played?

A: Activities will not be displayed.

Q: How many games can be displayed at a time?

A: Only 4 games can be displayed.

Q: Who can see Recent Games on my profile?

Recent Games will be visible to another user if you are friends, if you are suggested friends, if you’ve sent a friend request, or if you share at least one server where you have not disabled Activity Display.

Q: Will disabling Activity Display in a specific server prevent Recent Played Games from appearing on my profile?

Yes. However, if you enable it again at any point, your Recent Played Games (including anything that was played when it was turned off) will then be displayed in your profile.

articles.name: Discord Quests FAQ
articles.title: Discord Quests FAQ
articles.body:
Quests are a way for players to discover games and earn rewards for playing them on Discord. Whether you are playing or streaming your favorite game on Discord, you now have a chance to get rewards!

By completing Quests, you can unlock exclusive in-game items, gain in-game currency, or even Discord avatar decorations to showcase your achievements. Keep reading to learn more!

What this article covers:

  • Active Discord Quests
    • Krunker Strike FRVR
    • GTA Online
    • VALORANT 
  • Recently Finished Quests 
    • The Sims 4 
    • Zenless Zone Zero
    • Console Gaming
    • PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS
  • What are Discord Quests? 
  • How do I complete Discord Quests?
    • Accept the Quest
    • Stream a Game to Friends on Discord
    • Claim Your Reward
  • Opting-out of Quests Promotions
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Active Discord Quests

Krunker Strike FRVR - Mom, I'm Winning Quest

The Mom, I'm Winning Quest can be accepted on Discord from August 8, 2024 until August 15, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). The Methane Mask must be redeemed by September 14, 2024. Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.

GTA Online - GTA Online Quest

The GTA Online Quest can be accepted on Discord from August 8, 2024 until August 14, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). The Los Santos Avatar Decoration needs to be redeemed by September 14, 2024. Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward. 

VALORANT - Wingman Quest

The Wingman Quest can be accepted on Discord from July 26, 2024 until August 8, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). The Wingman avatar decoration needs to be redeemed by September 7, 2024. Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.

Recently Finished Quests 

The Sims 4 - Lovestruck Quest

The Lovestruck Quest can be accepted on Discord from July 25, 2024 until August 1, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). The Freezer Bunny Lovebug avatar decoration needs to be redeemed by September 1, 2024. Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.

Zenless Zone Zero - V1.0 Quest

The V1.0 Quest can be accepted on Discord from July 8, 2024 until July 15, 2024 (5:00PM PST). The Version 1.0 bundle needs to be redeemed by August 14, 2024 (3:00AM PST). Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.

Console Gaming Quest

The Console Gaming Quest can be accepted on Discord from June 26, 2024 until July 10, 2024 (11:59PM UTC).The Warp Helmet avatar decoration needs to be redeemed by August 9, 2024. 

Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS - Erangel Classic Quest

The Erangel Classic Quest can be accepted on Discord from May 14, 2024 until May 28, 2024 (11:59PM UTC). Quest requirements must be completed during this period to receive the reward. Reward gift codes expire August 11, 2024.

What are Discord Quests? 

Quests are a way for players to discover games and earn rewards for streaming them on Discord.

How do I complete a Discord Quest?

Here are the steps to complete a Discord Quest: 

1. Accept the Quest 

2. Complete the Quest Requirements

3. Claim your reward 

Please see below for more detailed information on how to complete each step. 

Accept the Quest 

Quests can only be accepted through the Discord desktop and browser apps.

You may see an alert in your Discord app about a Discord Quest. Hover over the Quest bar and select it to expand and learn more about the Quest. If you want to participate, you can press Accept Quest. 

If you don't see the Quest bar, navigate to your User Settings > Gift Inventory.

While there, you will see the active Discord Quests that are available to join. Press Accept Quest to join the quest.

Completing Quest Requirements 

Each Quest will have its own requirements:

  • Playtime Requirement - To fulfill a Quest, players must engage with the game for a specified duration (e.g., 15 minutes). Ensure you are logged into the Discord desktop app while playing to accurately track your progress. 
  • Streaming Requirement - To complete a Quest, players need to stream the game to at least one friend in a voice channel using the Discord desktop app for a minimum duration (e.g., 15 minutes). For more details on how to use Go Live and screen sharing, please refer to the Go Live and Screen Share support article.

Within each Quest’s Promotion Terms, you will find the steps on how to complete the Quest. 

Claim Your Reward 

Once you have completed the Quest, you can claim the reward by pressing the Claim Reward button within any Discord Quest in-app notification.

Users who have completed quests after April 24, 2024 will automatically obtain the Discord Quests Badge, which will be added to their profiles. For more information about profile badges, visit our Profile Badges 101 Help Center article.

The easiest way to claim your reward is by heading over to your User Settings > Gift Inventory. 

If you’re claiming an in-game item reward, you’ll be given a Discord Quest redemption code that you’ll need to redeem on the partnered game redemption website. You can find a link by heading over to our Active Discord Quests section and referring to the steps mentioned specifically for that Quest! You’ll also receive an email with redemption instructions once you’ve completed the Quest.

If you’re ready to claim a Discord reward, such as an avatar decoration, you can claim your reward by selecting the Claim Reward button.

Opting-out of Quests Promotions

If you’re not interested in receiving promotions of Discord Quests, you can control these promotions in the following ways: 

Hide an In-app Promotion of an Individual Quest 

If you still want to receive in-app promotions for future Quests, but you want to hide an in-app promotion for a specific Quest or game you’re not interested in, press the ellipsis [] on the Quest in-app promotion to access the menu and then select Hide This to hide this particular in-app promotion. 

Once you've done this, you'll no longer receive notifications about this Quest in that particular in-app promotion style. 

If you encounter a different in-app promotion for that same Quest (for example, you may also see the Quest in the Active Now section of the Discord app) you can hide those by following the steps mentioned above. 

If you hide all the in-app promotions of a specific Quest, you can still view and accept the Quest in your Gift Inventory.

Opt-out of personalized promotion for all Quests 

If you do not want to receive personalized promotions for any Quests based on your activity or data you share with Discord, you can disable your In-game rewards (aka Quests) settings within your Privacy & Safety settings. 

1. Press the cogwheel [] in the bottom left corner of your Discord desktop/browser app to navigate to your User Settings.

2. Then select the Privacy & Safety tab in the left hand panel and scroll down to the How We Use Your Data section.

3. Disable the In-game rewards (aka Quests) setting by selecting the toggle. You can learn more about how data is used for in-game rewards here. 

Although these settings are disabled, you will still be able to participate in Quests if you navigate to your Gift Inventory. You may see Quests shared by your friends or reflected in their activity status on Discord.

If you decide later that you want to receive notifications about Discord Quests based on your activity, you will need to make sure to enable the In-game rewards (aka Quests) setting in Privacy & Safety. You can learn more about these settings by visiting Data Privacy Controls or reading our Privacy Policy.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is there a limit on how many Quests I can redeem on my Discord account?

A: Eligible users can redeem one of each of the available Quest campaigns on their Discord account. 

Q: Is this feature/promotion available in my region?

A: Quests will not be available in certain regions. If you are in an ineligible region for a Quest, you will not be able to complete it.

Additionally, Discord’s premium services are restricted in some regions. If you are unable to access the Gift Inventory, you are not eligible for Quests.

Q: Why am I unable to see Quests on the Discord mobile app?

A: This feature is only available on the desktop and browser app.

Q: I have concerns or questions regarding privacy and Quests. 

A: ​​We encourage you to review Discord’s Privacy Policy for further details about how we use your information. You can head over to our Data Used for In-Game Rewards article, to learn more about how we use data for Quests. 

Q: Why am I unable to complete Quest while using Linux?

A: Currently, Quest rewards are unable to be earned on Linux devices. 

However, our team is looking into a resolution for this issue so that earning Quest rewards is possible on Linux in the future. For now, we recommend completing the requirement on a different operating system, like Windows or MacOS. 

Our support team does not have an exact ETA for when a solution will be available, and won't be able to provide any status updates on this specific issue.

Q: I no longer see a Quest. Where did it go?

A: Quests are typically only available for a limited amount of time. If you no longer see a Quest in the Gift Inventory or in-app notifications about the quest, the period to complete and claim the reward for the Quest is over.

Q: I have completed previous Quests. Why don’t I see the Discord Quests Badge in my profile?

A: If you have completed a Quest before April 24, 2024, the Discord Quests Badge will not appear in your profile. However, if you complete a Quest the Discord Quest after April 24, 2024 the Quests badge will be added to your profile. For more information about profile badges, visit our Profile Badges 101 Help Center article.

articles.name: Data Used for In-Game Rewards
articles.title: Data Used for In-Game Rewards
articles.body:
Discord In-Game Rewards are typically rewards or other experiences based on you interacting with the games you love while using Discord. You can view what Quests or other experiences are available on Discord through your Gift Inventory. 

We may tell you about Quests that we think will interest you based on the games you play or other information associated with your Discord account. If you’re not interested in receiving Discord Quests promotions, you can opt-out of this feature in your User Settings.

1. Open Discord and press the cogwheel [] in the bottom left corner to go to User Settings.

2. Then, select the Privacy & Safety tab within the left-hand panel.

3. Scroll down the page to the How We Use Your Data section and make sure to disable the In-game rewards (aka Quests) setting by selecting the toggle. 

4. If you decide later you want to be notified about Quest opportunities, you can enable this setting once again.

articles.name: Polls FAQ
articles.title: Polls FAQ
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • What is Polls?
  • How do I create a Poll?
    • Desktop
    • Mobile
  • How do I vote in a Poll?
    • Desktop
    • Mobile
  • How to manage Poll Permissions as a Server Owner/Administrator
    • Role Permission
    • Channel Permission
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is Polls?

Polls is a feature on Discord with which you can create a poll to have your friends and community members vote on anything! You can add up to 10 answers for people to vote on in each poll. This can help decide the next game you’ll play together for game night, if pineapple belongs on pizza, and so much more!

How do I create a Poll?

A poll can have up to 10 answers listed.

Any text within a poll (including questions and answers), will apply filters set by AutoMod.

Desktop

1. Tap on the plus sign [] located in the text field of the text channel, text chat of a voice channel, or group message that you want to share the poll in.

2. Next, tap Poll to create a new poll.

3. You can input the following information for your poll:

  • What the actual poll is about
  • All possible selectable answers users can vote on (you can also select an emoji or custom emoji to represent each one too)
  • How long the poll will available (1 hour, 4 hours, 8 hours, 24 hours, 3 days, or 1 week)
  • If those voting can select more than one answer

4. Once everything has been filled out, you can tap Post to send your poll!

Mobile

For the best experience with Polls on mobile, please make sure you’re running Discord app version 221 or higher.

1. Tap on the plus sign [] located in the text field of the text channel, text chat of a voice channel, or group message that you want to share the poll in.

2. Next, tap Poll to create a poll.

3. You can input the following information for your poll:

  • What the actual poll is about
  • All possible selectable answers users can vote on (you can also select an emoji or custom emoji to represent each one too)
  • How long the poll will be available (1 hour, 4 hours, 8 hours, 24 hours, 3 days, or 1 week)
  • If those voting can select more than one answer

4. Once everything has been filled out, you can tap on Post to send your poll!

How do I vote in a Poll?

Want to change your selection on a poll? Tap on Remove Vote to remove your vote and then you can vote again.

Desktop

1. Navigate to the poll you want to vote in and then tap on one answer or multiple answers to the poll. Once selected, you’ll see a check mark appear on the right hand side of the poll selection.

2. Tap Vote to submit your answer.

3. You know your vote has gone through once a check mark appears on the selection, and you’ll see the option to change your vote. 

Mobile

1. Navigate to the poll you want to vote on and tap on your vote.

2. Next, tap on Vote to submit your answer.

3. You’ll know your vote has gone through because you’ll see a check mark next to your vote.

How to manage Poll Permissions as a Server Owner/Administrator

Permissions for Polls can be managed from a server or channel level.

Role Permission

1. Tap on your server’s name in the top left corner and then tap on Server Settings.

2. Navigate to Roles and then select which role you’d like to change the permission for, or tap on Default Permissions to edit this role for everyone.

3. Scroll down until you see Create Polls. A “check mark” means this feature is enabled and an “x” means it’s disabled.  

4. Lastly, save your changes to apply them.

Channel Permission

1. Navigate to the channel you want to edit and tap on the cogwheel [].

2. Then, tap on Permissions. 

3. Under this setting you can enable or disable Polls per role. To do so, tap on the role you want to edit.

4. Now scroll down until you see Create Polls. A “check mark” means this feature is enabled and an “x” means it’s disabled.  

5. Lastly, save your changes to apply them.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Where can I start a poll? 

A: A poll can take place in a text channel, direct message, group message, or announcement channel.  

Q: How can I delete a poll?

A: The only way to delete a poll is to delete the entire message (by tapping on the “...” next to a message). Once the poll has been deleted, it can not be restored.

Q: Can I vote anonymously in a poll? 

A: No, there is no option to vote anonymously at this time. 

Q: How long can a poll be open for?

A: The poll creator chooses how long they want the poll to be open when creating the poll. The poll creator can choose to end the poll early at any time. Unless it ends early, a poll can be left open for up to 1 week.

Q: Can I use slash commands (for example: /poll) to create a poll?

A: No, it is not possible to create a poll using a slash command at this time.

Q: Can poll choices be modified at any time?

A: As long as the poll is still open, you can modify your poll choice. 

Q: Can poll results be saved and/or deleted?

A: While polls behave like messages in terms of being deleted, there is no separate function to archive polls at this time. You can pin a poll to Pinned Messages.

articles.name: Members List Recent Activity FAQ
articles.title: Members List Recent Activity FAQ
articles.body:
To learn more about activity status, check out the Activity Status (Recent Activity) article.

What this article covers: 

  • What is the Members List Recent Activity Feature?
  • How does the Feature Work?
    • Viewing Activity Cards
    • Engaging with Activity Cards
    • Types of Activity Content
    • Activity Privacy
  • Game Profile
  • Have Ideas or Feedback?

What is the Members List Recent Activity Feature?

This feature is currently in beta. It is limited to a small percentage of users within English-prominent regions and available only on the desktop app. This being the case, the experiment is subject to change or may be removed.

Want to easily catch up with your friends and create more shared experiences together?

With the Members List Recent Activity feature, you’ll be able to view the recent activities of your friends and recent contacts - including the video games they’re playing, the music they’re listening to, and much more!

How does the Feature Work?

Viewing Activity Cards

With the Members List Recent Activity feature, you’ll be able to view activity cards within Discord. Activity cards will show live and recent activities of those you’ve interacted with - within servers and your friends. 

If an activity is currently taking place, it’ll show an incrementing timer for how much time has elapsed. Otherwise, it’ll show how long ago the activity took place. 

You can collapse the view down to three activity cards and expand to see everything (up to 50 recent activities).

You can also choose to fully collapse activity cards or hide activity cards by selecting the cogwheel [] (within the activity card) and pressing the checkbox for the Hide Activity Cards option. 

Engaging with Activity Cards

Want to ask a friend about that new game they’re playing? By selecting the activity cards, you can reply directly to the activity or even send them an emoji. In either case, this will send a direct message (DM) with a reference to the activity.

 

Types of Activity Content

Initially, the content shown within activity cards will reflect gaming activity, but over time, other types of activity will also be shown - including game achievements, Spotify, Crunchyroll, and more.

Activity Privacy

If you want to prevent your activity from showing up in this feature, you can do so in two ways: 1) globally or 2) for a specific game.

Globally

If you want to control whether any activity is shared, you can enable or disable your global settings in the Activity Privacy settings. 

1. Head over to your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel [] in the bottom left corner.

2. Then under the Activity Settings section, select Activity Privacy. 

3. From here, you can use the toggle to enable or disable Share Activity with Others.

Specific Games

Alternatively, if you just want to prevent a specific game from being shared, you can disable specific games through the Registered Games menu. 

1. Head over to your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel [] in the bottom left corner.

2. Then under the Activity Settings section, select Registered Games.

3. From here, you can select the icon for Toggle Detection to prevent a game from showing up in the activity cards going forward.

Game Profile

This feature does not display on the browser or mobile app, and is only available on the desktop app (Windows, Mac, and Linux).

If someone is playing a game and a game profile exists for this game, you can tap on the game icon within the app and be provided with additional information. Here is how to access this.

1. Tap on the profile of the user you want to view (this can be done through a server’s members list in a server, DM, group chat message, or your friend’s list) and tap on the icon of the game they’re playing.

2. If the game has a game profile, the game icon will not only be clickable, but a page within the app will open to display information about the game. 

3. On a game profile, you can find any available information about the game (eg. genre, game summary, social links, Discord server, publisher, available platforms like device type, consoles, etc.)

It will also include screenshots and promotional art of the game, recommendations for similar games, and usernames of friends who have played the same game.

If a game does not have a game profile, it’s because not enough users have played the game to display any data.

Have Ideas or Feedback? 

Let us know via this link! We’re especially curious to hear what other types of activities you and your friend groups would have fun talking about together!
